intro: Legousia castellana var. grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often hairy to the touch. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
